title: Ousmane Dembele 'has to mature' to fulfil his potential, claims Barcelona team-mate Arturo Vidal
text:
Arturo Vidal has challenged Barcelona team-mate Ousmane Dembele to step up his professionalism - with the €105m winger falling far short of the hype.

The 32-year-old Chilean - who has a history of success at Europe's premier clubs - joined the Catalans a year after Dembele, who remains the sixth most expensive footballer ever.

The Frenchman has been heavily criticised by the demanding Nou Camp faithful, and his Barcalona story so far has been littered with injuries, fitness troubles, questions on his commitment and inconsistency on the pitch.

Arturo Vidal has said Ousmane Dembele has maturing to do before he can fulfil his potential

The €105m Frenchman has been inconsistent since signing and criticised for his commitment

Dembele shone for Borussia Dortmund, and Vidal backs the 22-year-old to fulfil his potential

Vidal backs Dembele to make the impact his price-tag warrants, but insists the 22-year-old has work to do.

'Ousmane is a football player who has a crazy talent. When he reaches maturity, he will be an important player for Barca and for France,' Vidal told L'Equipe.

'But, clearly, he has to mature, listen to his body and be better prepared to avoid injuries. If you want to be the best, you should get up, eat and go to bed thinking about football.

'I think Ousmane will realize at some point that he has to do more.'

Dembele has featured in just three of Barca's eight La Liga matches this season -struck again by injury. He had an eventful return before the international break, scoring and seeing red for dissent in a 4-0 win over Sevilla.

Dembele scored on his return to action against Sevilla, before being sent-off in the 4-0 win

Dembele has played in three of Barca's first eight games, struggling with a hamstring injury

He will miss the next two matches with suspension: yet another disruption to his career so far in Spain. At 22 Dembele has time on his side, and will benefit from mixing with highly experienced players such as Vidal.

'I talk to him a lot. He is a good boy and he is the first to want to be the best. He arrived at Barça at age 20, without much experience,' the former Juventus midfielder continued.

'Ousmane must become aware of what he really wants in life, know where he plays and who he plays with. But I think I see an evolution. It must continue like this.'
description: Arturo Vidal has challenged misfiring Barcelona team-mate Ousmane Dembele to step-up his professionalism - with the €105m winger falling far short of the hype.
